subject: RE: [junit] Is there a tool which generates JUnit-test stubs?
msgSnippet: Hi! Here with I have attached two files. There is a simple application JUtil.java , which I have written.This makes use of the reflection API s to generate
messageBody:
Hi!
Here with I have attached two files. There is a simple application
"JUtil.java", which I have written.This makes use of the reflection
API's to generate the skeleton of the test cases for the classes which
are already written. It generates the two test cases for each method in
the class with the suffix 'Good' and 'Bad'. we are using 'Good' method
for the positive test case and 'Bad' for the negative test case. So if
you want to add any other test cases, then you got to add it manually.

The usage goes like this,
Which takes the 3 arguments as follows,

commond: java JUtil arg1 arg2 arg3

arg1 = The production class for which you want to generate a test class
right from the package path..
For e.g., com.smf.portfolio.PORT_Update_Portfolio

arg2 = Full qualified path till the directory(in the specified format)
in which you want to store the generated ".java" file.
For e.g., d:\\com\\smf\\portfolio etc

arg3 = The name of the file what you want to give for the generated
".java" file.
For e.g., TestPortfolio (Note that this is without the
extension)

and one interesting thing would be if you have many clsses ready and if
you want to generate the test classes(the skeleton) for all the classes
in the package structure that is for all the class files in the folder
and subfolders and put the generated class files into the same folders,
then there is one more utility "JUtilForPackage.java" which will do the
job for you.

The usage for this goes like this,

commond: java JUtilForPackage arg1 arg2

arg1 = f:\\hari\\help\\Work_on_JUnit\\com
This is the path till first folder name from
where the
package structure starts and from where you want
generate the
test classes for all the class files in the
folders and subfolders.

arg2 = com
This should be name of the folder from where the
package
declaration begins.

PS: ONCE IF THE TEST CLASSES ARE GENERATED THEN, IF IT IS TRIED TO
GENERATE AGAIN THEN IT WILL OVERWRITE and WILL NOT APPEND. Let me
know if there is any problem in using these utilities.

Thanks and Regards
-Hari

-----Original Message-----
From: markus baumgartner [mailto:mbg@greenwaves.com]
Sent: Friday, March 15, 2002 9:44 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Is there a tool which generates JUnit-test stubs?



I'm spending a lot of time passing new method into the testclass and
write a
"test_" in front of it (and oftenly forget to do it, too).
I made a try to automate the creation of stubs for all existing methods
of a
class using the Reflection API (e.g. from myProcedure(int A, String B)
to
test_myProcedure_int_A_String_B. The final goal would be to have the
tool
comparing the class to the test_class and create stubs for new methods
while leaving the existing ones untouched.

Before I'm going to create it on my own, I wanted to know, if anybody
knows
about an existing tool, that does the job?

If it does not exist, is there a good reason, why this automation
wouldn't
make sense? Sometimes for complex function you may need several
testcases,
but they can be easely created by taking the first stub and append a
number...
